data.text: @WorkSafeNB @HallwayOrchard Thank you for your response- much appreciated.

@Shera_Richard74 @HallwayOrchard Hi Shera, 
No it has not .

@WorkSafeNB @HallwayOrchard Thank you for your reply.  “Biological agents include bacteria, viruses, fungi and parasites or parts thereof or products they generate.” 
I see common cold and Flu excluded - has Covid been officially added as an exclusion?

@HallwayOrchard @Shera_Richard74 2/2 See Communicable Disease Control for more info and a current list of notifiable diseases:  https://t.co/GpChrnLL6n 

WorkSafeNB has guidance to protect against communicable disease transmission:   https://t.co/mAJamucsEx  An updated version will be released soon.

@Shera_Richard74 @WorkSafeNB I've also asked @WorkSafeNB to clarify whether a list of communicable diseases meeting the "biological agent" definition exists and if so, who creates/administers the list.
I have not received a response yet.
@WorkSafeNB @HallwayOrchard Are there communicable diseases that @WorkSafeNB require reporting? What happens during an outbreak in those cases? Anything?
